Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
1

(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth was pushed up against a table and hit their foot and
ankle on the table causing injury. The youth did not receive
medical attention. The youth was observed walking with a limp
4/10/25 and a medical appointment was scheduled.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on April 15, 2025.
Complainant reported seeing Youth A limping on 4/10/25.
Complainant described being told by Youth A and Director of
Residential a medical appointment for Youth A was scheduled for
either 4/10/25 or 4/11/25. However, Complainant learned on
4/14/25 the appointment he was told about was for a dental
appointment. Complainant reported having concerns Youth A still
had not been seen by medical to rule out the allegations of a
fracture. Complainant reported exchanging emails with Director of
Residential, Nurse, and Vice President of Treatment Programs on
4/14/25 requesting again that Youth A be seen by a doctor that
day (emails in document review section).
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 16,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse reported
seeing Youth A on 4/11/2025 and observing “light swelling” on
Youth A’s ankle. Nurse stated Youth A told him he [Youth A]
rolled it when he stood up in the cafeteria moving a chair. Nurse
described Youth A stating he had an ankle splint at the house
(facility), so Nurse asked staff (could not recall what staff) to get
the splint and place it on Youth A’s ankle. Nurse stated Youth A
went to urgent care on 4/15/2025 because staff could not locate
the splint. Nurse reported seeing Youth A the evening of
4/11/2025 doing an activity in the field at the facility and Youth A
seemed to be walking around fine. Nurse reported when he
asked Youth A on 4/15/2025 if his ankle was feeling better, Youth
A said “yes but no.” Nurse stated he provided ice to Youth A on
4/15/2025 and sent Youth A to urgent care because Youth A did
not have a splint.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
he was wearing an ankle brace due to getting injured during a
restraint with Supervisor last week. Youth A described seeing
Nurse after the restraint with Supervisor and was provided an ice
pack and some medication to help with the pain. Youth A stated
his ankle was twisted when he was getting pushed and pulled into
2

the tables during the restraint. Youth A stated he told Nurse he
had an ankle brace at the house but when Youth A returned to the
house, he could not locate the brace. Youth A stated he recalled
his worker had the brace and told Nurse on 4/15/2025 he did not
have a brace. Youth A stated he was taken to the ER on
4/15/2025 for x-rays and received the ankle brace.
Attempts were made April 16 and April 17, 2025, to interview
Youth B in person at the facility in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. On April 16, 2025, Youth B walked into the interview
room, said “nope” and walked out, refusing to return to be
interviewed. On April 17, 2025, Youth B refused to come to the
interview room to be interviewed.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C stated
Youth A could not walk on his ankle after the incident with
Supervisor in the cafeteria. Youth C reported Youth A now had a
brace on his ankle and appeared to be walking better. Youth C
stated he could not recall when Youth A started wearing the ankle
brace.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 16,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported the
day after the incident in the cafeteria between Youth A and
Supervisor, Youth A was playing basketball but did say his ankle
hurt. Staff 1 denied seeing Youth A since the day he played
basketball.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 16,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
Nurse coming into the cafeteria when the incident between Youth
A and Supervisor was taking place. Staff 2 reported Youth A saw
Nurse after the incident because Youth A stated he hurt his ankle.
Staff 2 denied knowing how Youth A hurt his ankle. Staff 2 stated
he is aware Youth A has been wearing an ankle brace but was not
part of any of Youth A’s medical care.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
denied Youth A ever saying anything to him regarding his ankle
being sore or hurt.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Therapist
described talking with Youth A the night of 4/14/25 and Youth A
3

reported his ankle hurt. Therapist stated she took Youth A to
Nurse on 4/15/2025 and Nurse sent Youth A to urgent care.
Documents Reviewed:
• Emails dated 4/14/2025 from Complainant to Director of
Residential, Vice President of Treatment Programs, Nurse
and DHHS Worker asking for Youth A to be medically
assessed and to have his ankle examined.
• Corewell Health Reed City Hospital After Visit Summary for
Youth A dated 4/15/2025. Report lists diagnosis as,
“Sprain of left ankle, unspecified ligament, initial
encounter.” An air splint was provided to Youth A.
• Corewell Health Reed City Hospital SHRC Emergency
Report for Youth A dated 4/15/2025. Report lists diagnosis
as, “Spain of left ankle, unspecified ligament, initial
encounter.” Report documents History of present illness
as, “[Youth A] is a 16 y.o. male who presents to the
emergency department with their parent complaining of left
ankle pain. Patient states just shy of a week ago he was
playing basketball and rolled his ankle and since then he
has had pain in the outside of the left ankle.”
• Eagle Village Medical Standard of Operating Procedures
Policy. Policy documents, “Systems will be in place to
ensure a prompt response to our resident's health care
needs in a manner that is appropriate to the severity of the
issue.”
• Eagle Village Health Care Visit reports for Youth A. Nurse
notes dated document, “Ankle swelling. Small amount of
swelling seen just posterior to his lateral malleolus of his lt.
ankle. He stated that he had a splint in his personals.
Talked with house supervisor to bring the splint up to
nursing to see if would be appropriate to help heal his
ankle. Treatment Provided: waiting for splint.” Second
Nurse notes dated documents, “Staff brought [Youth A] to
nursing to check on his ankle. [Youth A] stated that he was
able to play sports over the weekend, but his ankle was
and wasn't better. The splint was not found in his personals
and the ankle still had a small amount of swelling present.
Treatment provided: Sent into hospital for treatment.”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per Nurse, Therapist,
Director of Residential, and Youth A interviews as well as an email
exchanged between Complainant and administration at the facility,
Youth A was not taken to the emergency department until six days
after Youth A initially complained of pain in his left ankle, and five
after Complainant requested Youth A be seen to rule a fracture.
4

Nurse evaluated Youth A on 4/09/2025 and felt an ankle splint
was needed. Youth A believed he had an ankle splint/brace he
brought with him but realized the same day he did not have it with
him. Youth A did not get an ankle splint until 4/15/25 after going
to the emergency room.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/9/25, a youth had a staff member's keys. The staff member
threatened to physically harm another youth if they touched the
keys. This youth engaged in a verbal altercation with the staff
member and the staff member threatened to fight the youth.
Another staff attempted to intervene and deescalate the situation.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
Youth B had Supervisor’s keys and was not giving the keys back
to Supervisor. Youth A stated he believes Youth B took
Supervisor’s keys off the table. Youth A described asking Youth B
for the keys so he could give the keys back to Supervisor. Youth
A reported Supervisor said, “You touch my keys you’re gonna
miss your arm.” Youth A stated he asked Supervisor, “who you
talking to? Is that a threat? I’ll beat your ass, don’t test me.” Youth
A described Staff 2 redirecting Youth A away from the situation
when Supervisor responded back telling Youth A “it’s not a threat,
it's a promise.” Youth A stated he told Supervisor “Let’s go
outside” and Supervisor responded with “I’m going there now.”
Youth A described during the physical altercation with Supervisor
(described below in a different rule violation) Supervisor said, “I’ll
fuck you up [Youth A].” Youth A reported Staff 1 was trying to
keep Supervisor separated from him [Youth A] and calm
Supervisor down while Staff 2 was trying to calm Youth A down.
Youth A denied ever seeing or hearing Supervisor act this way
before with any youth.
5

Attempts were made April 16 and April 17, 2025, to interview
Youth B in person at the facility in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. On April 16, 2025, Youth B walked into the interview
room, said “nope” and walked out, refusing to return to be
interviewed. On April 17, 2025, Youth B refused to come to the
interview room to be interviewed.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C
reported the “new kid” [Youth B] took Supervisor’s keys off the
table. Youth C described Supervisor sitting at the table and
having his keys sitting on the table in front of him [Supervisor].
Youth C stated Youth A asked Youth B for the keys so he could
give the keys back to Supervisor. Youth C reported Supervisor
told Youth A, “If you touch my keys, you’re not gonna have a
hand.” Youth C stated Youth A said something like, “I don’t like
threats” and Supervisor responded back to Youth A with “It’s not a
threat, it’s a promise.” Youth C described Supervisor walking
toward Youth A and Youth A telling Supervisor, “We can take this
outside.” Youth C stated Supervisor responded with “that’s where
I’m going.” Youth C reported there was “a lot of verbal arguing
between both [Youth A and Supervisor].” Youth C stated Staff 2
was trying to get between Youth A and Supervisor and redirect
Youth A, while Staff 1 was with the younger youth. Youth C denied
ever seeing or hearing Supervisor act this way before with any
youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 16,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported the
new youth, Youth B, took Supervisor’s keys off the table. Staff 1
stated Supervisor’s keys were just sitting on the table in front of
Supervisor. Staff 1 reported keys are to be stored in a person’s
pocket but stated Supervisor has a lot of keys, so it is probably
uncomfortable to sit down with the keys. Staff 1 described Youth A
was trying to help by asking Youth B to give him the keys so
Youth A could return the keys to Supervisor. Staff 1 stated
Supervisor told Youth A, “no don’t help, don’t give the keys to
[Youth A].” Staff 1 reported Youth A got upset by what Supervisor
said, stood up and said, “who you think you’re talking to?” Staff 1
stated the only thing she heard Supervisor say to Youth A was
“you need to sit down; you need to back up.” Staff 1 denied
hearing Supervisor make any threats towards Youth A. Staff 1
described there being a lot of commotion and being focused on
getting the younger youth out of the cafeteria. Staff 1 reported she
radioed for assistance and focused on getting the younger youth
6

away from the situation. Staff 1 stated the only threats she heard
were the ones made by Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 16,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
Youth B taking Supervisor’s keys off the table and walking around
the cafeteria with the keys. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 and Supervisor
were verbally asking Youth C to give Supervisor back the keys.
Staff 2 described Youth A asking Youth B for the keys to give back
to Supervisor and Supervisor saying, “don’t touch my keys.” Staff
2 reported Youth A stood up and started arguing and Supervisor
also stood up. Staff 2 described Youth A and Supervisor having a
“heated exchange.” Staff 2 stated he could not recall exactly what
was being said between Youth A and Supervisor but they both
were swearing and one of them said something about going
outside. Staff 2 reported staff are not trained to talk to youth the
way Supervisor was talking to Youth A. Staff 2 described
Supervisor as being escalated but stated he honestly could not
recall what Supervisor was saying because it was so chaotic.
Staff 2 reported he got between Youth A and Staff 2 and was
talking to Youth A to de-escalate the situation. Staff 2 stated this
was the first time he has seen or heard Supervisor interact with a
youth like he did with Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
stated he placed the keys on the table in front of him and Youth C
“snatched” the keys off the table. Supervisor described Youth A
asking Youth B to give him [Youth A] the keys and Supervisor told
Youth A, “please don’t touch my keys.” Supervisor denied being
disrespectful when telling Youth A to not touch his keys.
Supervisor reported Youth A stood up, walked toward Supervisor
with a clenched fist and Staff 2 moved in-between Supervisor and
Youth A. Supervisor reported Youth A was the one who asked
Supervisor to go outside, and Supervisor stated he ignored the
comment. Supervisor stated he was matching Youth A’s energy
and had a raised voice but never swore or threatened Youth A.
Video Review
Video footage of 4/09/25 in the cafeteria was reviewed on 4/16/25.
The video does not have sound, so it is unknown what Supervisor
said to Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Safety Plan for Supervisor. Safety Plan states, “This email
is a follow up to the conversation that we had today
7

(4/2/25). Due to the incident which occurred on 4/1/25 at
Hainley House, you are being placed on a safety plan
which includes not being alone with youth. You are also not
to respond to issues involving the youth, [Youth D]. We will
be conducting an investigation and will update you with
information as I have it.”
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was one disciplinary
action form dated 07/09/23 not related to interactions with
youth. Supervisor completed the required Aegis training on
12/12/24, NEO training on orientation/policies on 06/08/22
and Culture of Care training on 6/05/24.
• Eagle Village Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy
documents, “At all times, staff shall treat residents and
coworkers with respect and dignity in words and actions. All
staff will strive to be professional in behavior, conversation
and all interactions with others.”
• Eagle Village Behavior Plans Policy documents, “The
following are examples of behavior management methods
which are NOT to be used: a. Verbal abuse of a resident by
staff. Residents are not to be called "names," racial slurs,
sarcastically addressed or put down or deliberately
embarrassed.”
• Incident Report authored by Supervisor dated 04/09/25 in
the cafeteria. Incident report does not accurately reflect
what video shows, or interviews with Youth A, Youth C, and
Staff 2.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per Staff 2, Youth A, and
Youth C interviews Supervisor was swearing at Youth A and
escalating the situation.
Technical Assistance:
Technical Assistance was offered for the facility to review and
update policy to include proper storage of staffs’ keys. The
current policy only addresses the storage of the facility’s vehicle
keys.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
8

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth attempted to swing at the staff member and the staff
member grabbed the youth's arm and twisted it behind their back.
The youth was pushed up against a staff and hit their foot and
ankle on the table causing injury.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A
described during the physical altercation with Supervisor in the
cafeteria, his arm was grabbed by Supervisor, and he was
slammed onto the table by Supervisor, landing on his back. Youth
A reported he punched Supervisor twice and Supervisor pulled
Youth A up from the table by his shoulder area, slammed him onto
another table then picked him up and pushed him into the wall.
Youth A described Staff 2 trying to get in between Supervisor and
Youth A the entire time, while Staff 1 was trying to get the younger
youth out of the cafeteria. Youth A reported many other staff
arrived and Supervisor walked out of the cafeteria.
Attempts were made April 16 and April 17, 2025, to interview
Youth B in person at the facility in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. On April 16, 2025, Youth B walked into the interview
room, said “nope” and walked out, refusing to return to be
interviewed. On April 17, 2025, Youth B refused to come to the
interview room to be interviewed.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C
described Supervisor using both hands and grabbing Youth A by
Youth A’s shirt and slamming him onto a table, picking Youth A up
by his shirt, slamming Youth A onto another table, and then
picking Youth A up and slamming him into a heavy door while in
the cafeteria. Youth C stated Staff 2 was trying to separate Youth
A and Supervisor by getting between them, while Staff 1 was with
the younger youth. Youth C reported it ended when Staff 2 was
able to get in-between Supervisor and Youth A, and Supervisor
walked out of the cafeteria. Youth C stated it was very quick and
then it was over.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 16,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
Youth A stood up and approached Supervisor. Staff 2 also stood
up. Staff 1 thought Supervisor was grabbing his items to leave the
cafeteria. Staff 1 stated Youth A got around Staff 2 and tried to
assault Supervisor. Staff 1 stated she was focused on getting the
younger youth away from the situation and out of the cafeteria.
9

Staff 1 reported she did not really see the whole incident. Staff 1
denied standing between Youth A and Supervisor or placing her
hands on each of their chests to separate them.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 16,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
Youth A and Supervisor arguing with one another, so Staff 2
walked over and stood in front of Youth A. Staff 2 reported he
used proximity the best he could to keep Youth A and Supervisor
apart. Staff 2 stated Youth A got around him and assaulted
Supervisor. Staff 2 described being able to get between
Supervisor and Youth A and tried to break up what was occurring.
Staff 2 reported he honestly could not describe what was
occurring as things were happening so quickly while Supervisor
and Youth A were moving around the room. Staff 2 stated
Supervisor ended up walking out of the cafeteria and other staff
arrived for assistance. Staff 2 reported he was not sure if
Supervisor was trying to restrain Youth A or what Supervisor was
trying to do to Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported Youth A stood up, walked toward Supervisor with a
clenched fist and Staff 2 moved in-between Supervisor and Youth
A. Supervisor described moving away to create space but Youth A
was able to get around Staff 2 and grab Supervisor’s shirt.
Supervisor stated he attempted to do a two-person restraint but
was unsuccessful. Supervisor reported Youth A had Supervisor’s
shirt with one hand, swung at him twice with the other hand all
while they [Youth A, Staff 2 and Supervisor] moved all over the
room. Supervisor stated they all fell onto a table, got back up and
that is when Staff 2 was able to get between Youth A and
Supervisor so Supervisor could leave the cafeteria. Supervisor
reported Youth A was holding Supervisor’s shirt and Staff 2 was in
between Supervisor and Youth A. Supervisor stated it happened
really fast. Supervisor reported Staff 2 was doing what he could,
and Staff 1 took the younger youth to get them away from the
situation. Supervisor denied being held back from Youth A by Staff
1 or Staff 2 at any time. Supervisor reported he did not walk out of
the cafeteria earlier because sometimes as staff you have to show
you are not scared or be intimidated by youth. Supervisor denied
grabbing, pushing or pulling Youth A.
Video Review
Video footage of 4/09/25 in the cafeteria was reviewed on 4/16/25.
The video does not have sound. Video shows Supervisor sitting
10

down at a table in the cafeteria and placing a set of keys on the
table. Youth B is seen grabbing the keys off the table and walking
around the cafeteria. Youth C is sitting at a table and extends his
hand out to Youth B. Staff 1 follows Youth B as he walks around,
Supervisor stands up and approaches Youth B. Youth B is seen
giving the keys back to Supervisor. Supervisor walks around a
table and toward Youth A. Youth A stands up from the table and
Staff 1 moves to stand in front of Youth A. Youth A moves around
the table toward Supervisor. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are seen standing
between Youth A and Supervisor. Staff 1 moves between Youth A
and Supervisor and has one hand on each of their chests.
Supervisor is by a door, opens the door a little bit but does not
leave the cafeteria. Supervisor grabs his backpack, heads toward
the door, and makes a gesture with his hand while Staff 2 is
standing in front of Youth A. Youth A gets around Staff 2 and runs
toward Supervisor. Staff 2 is in between Supervisor and Youth A
and a struggle begins. Youth A lands on his back on a table, is
seen swinging at Supervisor and Supervisor is seen grabbing
Youth A by the collar of his shirt pulling Youth A up off the table.
The struggle continues with all of them landing on another table,
bumping into another table and then moving to a wall. Staff 2 gets
between Supervisor and Youth A and Youth A leaves the room.
The incident lasted approximately 30 seconds.
Documents Reviewed:
• Safety Plan for Supervisor. Safety Plan states, “This email
is a follow up to the conversation that we had today
(4/2/25). Due to the incident which occurred on 4/1/25 at
Hainley House, you are being placed on a safety plan
which includes not being alone with youth. You are also not
to respond to issues involving the youth, [Youth D]. We will
be conducting an investigation and will update you with
information as I have it.”
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was one disciplinary
action form dated 07/09/23 not related to interactions with
youth. Supervisor completed the required Aegis training on
12/12/24, NEO training on orientation/policies on 06/08/22
and Culture of Care training on 6/05/24.
• Eagle Village Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy
documents, “At all times, staff shall treat residents and
coworkers with respect and dignity in words and actions. All
staff will strive to be professional in behavior, conversation
and all interactions with others.”
• Eagle Village Behavior Plans Policy documents, “It is Eagle
Village policy that physical abuse is never accepted in any
manner as an interaction between staff and clients.
11

Examples of physical abuse could be, but are not limited to:
paddling, spanking, hitting, slapping, kicking, hair pulling,
throwing, severe shaking, inappropriate touching with an
object, or an inappropriate therapeutic hold.”
• Eagle Village Behavior Support and Management. Policy
states, “Behavior support and management is more than
just managing the youths’ physical behavior; it involves the
entire treatment process to the end of helping the youth
manage their own behavior in a socially healthy and
respectful manner. Any staff member found using
unacceptable discipline practices will immediately be
subject to disciplinary action up to termination.”
• Incident Report authored by Supervisor dated 04/09/25 in
the cafeteria. Incident report does not accurately reflect
what video shows, or interviews with Youth A, Youth C, and
Staff 2.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, Supervisor pushed Youth A onto a
table, pulled Youth A up from the table and held Youth A against
the wall.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2025SIC0000526 dated 05/15/2025; CAP pending
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
